notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat OpenShift GitOps 1.11.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Openshift GitOps is a declarative way to implement continuous deployment for cloud native applications.

Security Fix(es):

* Before this update, due to the improper filtering of URL protocols in the Argo CD application summary component, an attacker could achieve cross-site scripting with permission to edit the application. This update fixes the issue by upgrading the Argo CD version to v2.9.8 which has the fix applied and is therefore not vulnerable (CVE-2024-28175).
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Argo CD. Due to improper filtering of URL protocols in the application summary component, a remote attacker can execute a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack with privileges to edit the application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: argo-cd: XSS vulnerability in application summary component
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: argo-cd: XSS vulnerability in application summary component
